doc.field: Rolls Royce to go to VW after all?

The Vickers group now intends to sell Rolls Royce not to BMW but to VW. They said in London that VW made an offer exceeding the BMW one by some DM 264 million. Vickers chairman Chandler (sp?) said their aim was to sell Rolls Royce with maximum gain for shareholders. He will therefore recommend voting in favour of sale to VW at the special assembly coming up early in June. Just a few days ago, an agreement with BMW had been reached. The Munich based company did not want to comment tonight on the possibility of tendering an improved offer. BMW has been producing engines and components for Rolls and is threatening with termination of these supplies.
Sizable economies at Daimler-Benz and Chrysler through merger

Daimler-Benz and Chrysler expect a merger to save them a total of DM 2.5 billion as soon as next year. Within a few years, plans are to save DM 5 billion a year. The improvement of the cost situation is to be obtained through mutual use of facilities, technology sharing and joint purchasing and sales organizations. According to both companies, there are no plans for plant shutdowns and dismissals.
Kohl demands full compliance with Near-East peace treaty

Federal Chancellor Kohl has shown himself worried about the slow process of peace making in the Near East. At the same time he demanded that the Oslo accord on Near East peace be fully implemented. Kohl said hate, violence, suffering and persecution must come to an end. At the same time, the Chancellor stressed the special aspects of German-Israeli relations. In spite of the Nazi holocaust, real friendship has grown between the two nations, he said during a reception in honour of the 50th anniversary of the State of Israel.
Ministers stop bickering over gene files

Minister for interior Kanther and minister for justice Schmidt-Jorzig have put an end to their fight about setting up gene files. They came to a consensus that the so-called "genetic fingerprint" could be lifted and filed from all legally condemned persons. There is not to be a special law, but just an amendment to criminal process procedures. The gene file, to be administrated by the Wiesbaden Federal Criminal Office, is meant to increase the speed of discovering and arresting repeaters. To identify a culprit, remains of blood, skin, saliva or sperm can be used; often just a single hair is sufficient.
German ecology ministers demand reform of EU tax legislation

The federal and state ministers for ecology, in a Heidelberg meeting today, called on the EU-Commission to put higher tax stress on anti-ecological and anti-conservationist activities while reducing taxes on employment. They said the whole tax system must be reformed taking ecological criteria into account. Westfalia's minister for ecology, Ms. Hoehn, said a whole new tax system with ecological aspects was called for. EU commissar for ecology Ms. Bjeregord (sp?) is taking part in the meeting
BVG criticizes German non-compliance with EU conservation laws

The federal administrative court (BVG) will present a decision in the case of construction of the Baltic Autobahn A20 within two weeks. At today's proceedings, the presiding justice criticized the slow implementation of European conservation laws in Germany. Main part of the case before the court is a complaint against construction of a stretch near Luebeck. Ecological organizations have been criticizing that the planners of the road disregarded European conservation laws.
Tariff talks in chemical industry not closing the gap

No approach between parties has been evidenced at the probably decisive round of talks between employers and unions in West Germany's chemical industry area. According to chief negotiator Dugowius (sp?) of the DAG [national union of employees; whitecollar workers' union], speaking in Bad Wildungen, there has up to now been no offer from employers. The unions want a 5 to 5.5% wage increase.
